      • lastUsedSpot

        public int lastUsedSpot(int r,
                        int c)
        Returns the largest number (minus 1) covered in grid location (r,c).
        Parameters:
        r - Row - 0, 1, 2, 3
        c - Column - 0, 1, 2, 3
        Returns:
        The index of the largest number covered in grid location (r,c). -1 is returned if no stones have been placed in that location.

      • computeNewPoints

        public int computeNewPoints(int r,
                            int c,
                            char sym)
        Computes the points obtained by a player placing their stone in (r,c).
        Parameters:
        r - Row where the stone was placed 0, 1, ... ROWS-1
        c - Column where stone was placed 0, 1, ... COLS-1
        sym - The symbol of the player that just placed their stone - 'B' or 'Y'
        Returns:
        The points awarded by this move.

      • parseMsgString

        public void parseMsgString(java.lang.String s)
        Description copied from class: GameState
        Recreates the board game's state from a string representation. In particular, the string is a string generated as a "message" string (i.e., one without newlines). This method must be able to fill in the "board", who's next, number of moves performed, and whether or not the game ends with this move.
        Specified by:
        parseMsgString in class GameState
        Parameters:
        s - Message string representation of the state.
